SEARCH
Package com.github.siroshun09.event4j.simple

Interface EventServiceProvider<K,E,O>

Type Parameters:
K - the key type
E - the event type
O - the order type
public interface EventServiceProvider<K,E,O>
An interface to provide simple implementations of interfaces such as EventCaller and EventSubscriber.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static interface 
    EventServiceProvider.Factory<K,E,O>
    A factory interface to create EventServiceProvider.

  • Method Details

    • factory

      @Contract(" -> new") static <K, E, O> @NotNull EventServiceProvider.Factory<K,E,O> factory()
      Creates a new EventServiceProvider.Factory.
      Type Parameters:
      K - the key type
      E - the event type
      O - the order type
      Returns:
      a new EventServiceProvider.Factory

    • eventClass

      @NotNull @NotNull Class<E> eventClass()
      Gets the root class of events.
      Returns:
      the root class of events

    • caller

      @NotNull @NotNull EventCaller<E> caller()
      Gets the EventCaller.

      This EventCaller also dispatches to listeners of the higher class of the given event.

      Returns:
      the EventCaller implementation

    • isAsyncCallerAvailable

      boolean isAsyncCallerAvailable()
      Checks if this provider supports getting AsyncEventCaller by calling asyncCaller().

      If the Executor is set through EventServiceProvider.Factory.executor(Executor), this method returns true; otherwise false.

      Returns:
      true if asyncCaller() can be used in this provider, otherwise false

    • asyncCaller

      @NotNull @NotNull AsyncEventCaller<E> asyncCaller()
      Gets the AsyncEventCaller that created with caller() and the Executor which is set through EventServiceProvider.Factory.executor(Executor).

      If the Executor is not set, this method throws IllegalStateException.

      Returns:
      the AsyncEventCaller
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the Executor is not set (isAsyncCallerAvailable() returns false)

    • subscriber

      @NotNull <T extends E> @NotNull EventSubscriber<K,T,O> subscriber(@NotNull @NotNull Class<T> eventClass)
      Gets the EventSubscriber of the given event class.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the event type
      Parameters:
      eventClass - the event class to get EventSubscriber
      Returns:
      the EventSubscriber of the given event class

    • subscribers

      @NotNull @NotNull @Unmodifiable Collection<EventSubscriber<K,? extends E,O>> subscribers()
      Gets all currently available EventSubscribers.
      Returns:
      all currently available EventSubscribers in this provider.

    • subscribeAll

      @NotNull @NotNull Collection<SubscribedListener<K,? extends E,O>> subscribeAll(@NotNull @NotNull Iterable<ListenerBase<K,? extends E,O>> listeners)
      Subscribes the given ListenerBase.
      Parameters:
      listeners - the ListenerBase to subscribe
      Returns:
      the SubscribedListeners

    • unsubscribeAll

      void unsubscribeAll(@NotNull @NotNull Collection<? extends SubscribedListener<K,? extends E,O>> listeners)
      Unsubscribes the given SubscribedListeners.
      Parameters:
      listeners - the SubscribedListeners to unsubscribe

    • unsubscribeByKey

      void unsubscribeByKey(@NotNull K key)
      Unsubscribes listeners by the given key.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to unsubscribe listeners
